results.title: Novo Tellus wins Private Equity Deal of the Year Award from SVCA with its investment in TDConnex
results.description: SINGAPORE, Sept. 22, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Novo Tellus, a leading investment firm in Singapore focused on the global supply chain, has won the 2025 Private Equity Deal of the Year award from the Singapore Venture Capital & Private Equity Association (SVCA) for its investment in TDConnex. Novo Tellus wins Private Equity Deal of the Year Award from SVCA with its investment in TDConnex Novo Tellus developed a co-entrepreneurial relationship with TDConnex founder Thanga Venkatachalam, working with him over a year to re-imagine and transform a large-scale divisional manufacturing business. Novo Tellus co-authored the business plan to restructure TDConnex as an independent, Singapore-based company with a global manufacturing platform serving leading electronics innovators worldwide. Today, TDConnex produces over 4 billion components and 3,000 different parts that power over 1 billion electronic devices in use around the world. The divisional carveout investment was completed April 2024 in partnership with 65 Equity Partners and together with several Novo Tellus Limited Partner co-investors. During the investment development, TDConnex built its first factory in India and inaugurated its new global headquarters in Singapore, reflecting the Novo Tellus approach of diligence by 'building, rather than studying businesses'. SVCA noted that PE Deal of the Year award was its most heavily competed award, and cited TDConnex as an example of "private equity's power to reimagine industries": "The PE Deal of the Year is awarded to Novo Tellus Capital Partners, for their transformative investment in TDConnex. Through deep sector expertise and close collaboration with founder Thanga V, Novo Tellus helped TDConnex grow into a global hyperscale manufacturing leader, expanding into India, building a new HQ in Singapore, and scaling capabilities across continents." Reflecting on the investment, Keith Toh at Novo Tellus said, "Most private equity investments begin with due diligence on management's business plan. This investment began with a great conversation with Thanga (CEO of TDConnex), and a 40-page business plan we sat down and wrote together. By doing this, we built a trusted partnership with an exceptional CEO, a new global strategy for TDConnex, and an ambitious industrial vision for the future of component manufacturing in a global hyperscale context. This approach to entrepreneurial, industrialist partnership is emblematic of what Novo Tellus stands for. We're grateful to Thanga, 65 Equity Partners, and our customer and employee stakeholders for believing in a wildly ambitious future for TDConnex, and for working hard to turn it into a reality that has already surpassed all initial expectations." After accepting the SVCA Award, TDConnex CEO Thanga Venkatachalam reflected, "TDConnex was built to bring extraordinary people together with the best manufacturing capabilities, to serve extraordinary innovators. From the first conversation with Novo Tellus it was clear they understood the capabilities, people, and agility it takes to move advanced manufacturing into the future. We're honoured by the SVCA award, and pleased to be empowered by such an unusually entrepreneurial partnership with our investors." About Novo TellusNovo Tellus is a specialised investment firm with over US$1 billion under management, focused on building remarkable companies in the $2 trillion global supply chain. The firm forms close partnerships with business leaders to create lasting growth by growing core business products, services, people, and value to customers. Novo Tellus investors come from engineering, operating, entrepreneurial and investing backgrounds to build empathic and deeply-informed partnerships with management teams to realise ambitious growth together. About TDConnexTDConnex helps global technology leaders create and deliver the products that change the way the world lives and works. Its micro-precision components can be found in over a billion technology products worldwide, and the Company is focused on helping customers create the next generation of advanced electronic products for humanity's future. TDConnex is headquartered in Singapore and produces over 4 billion components annually across more than 3,000 different parts out of its global manufacturing facilities.

results.title: معلمة سعودية تحصد المركز الأول في "الداتاثون" على مستوى الخليج
creator: عبدالعزيز العمري - جدة
results.description: حققت المعلمة وفاء عبدالله الشهري، معلمة الدراسات الاجتماعية بالمرحلة الثانوية من إدارة تعليم المنطقة الشرقية، إنجازاً تربوياً بارزاً بفوزها بالمركز الأول في مسابقة “الداتاثون التربوي لدول الخليج العربي”، التي أقيمت في دورتها الثانية بدولة قطر، بالتعاون مع وزارة التربية والتعليم، وذلك في مسار“ملخصات الكتب”.ويعكس هذا التتويج مكانة الكفاءات التعليمية السعودية وقدرتها على المنافسة والابتكار في المحافل الخليجية.شعور بالفخر والاعتزازوقالت الشهري ل“اليوم”: الحمد لله أولاً وأخيراً على هذا التوفيق الذي منّ الله به عليّ، فالفوز بالمركز الأول في مسابقة إقليمية كبرى لم يكن مجرد لحظة فرح، بل هو شعور ممتزج بالفخر والاعتزاز، ورسالة بأن جهود المعلّم السعودي تجد صداها في الميدان التربوي الخليجي.هذا الإنجاز يعني أن تعب الأمس تحوّل إلى لحظة مجد، وأن الطريق بات ممهداً لطموحات أكبر ومشاريع أكثر عمقاً في المستقبل. وأضافت: "تجربتي في مسار ملخصات الكتب كانت ثرية ومليئة بالدروس، فقد أتاحت لي فرصة الغوص في جوهر الأفكار، والقدرة على استخلاص المفاهيم الأساسية وصياغتها في قوالب موجزة وجذابة. لقد تعلمت كيف أوائم بين إدارة الوقت والدقة في العرض، وكيف أحوّل القراءة الفردية إلى مشروع إبداعي يثري القارئ والمتلقي على حد سواء".وتابعت الشهري قائلة: "استعدادي للمسابقة انطلق من شغفي بمتابعة التجارب السابقة، وحضوري للورش التدريبية التي عرّفتنا بأعمال الفائزين في الدورة الأولى، وهو ما أشعل داخلي الحافز لخوض التحدي. وما ساعدني كثيراً أن شروط المشاركة ومعاييرها كانت واضحة وسهلة، مما أزال العقبات وفتح الطريق لتحقيق الهدف".دعم التفكير النقدي والإبداعوأشارت إلى أن القيمة التربوية لمثل هذه المبادرات لا تقف عند حدود الفوز، بل تتجلى في تعزيز ملكات التفكير النقدي والإبداع، ودفع المعلمين والمعلمات نحو التطوير المهني المستمر، وإبراز دورهم في إثراء العملية التعليمية.وفي ما يتعلق بآلية نقل التجربة لزميلاتها وزملائها، أكدت: "أطمح إلى مشاركة هذه التجربة عبر تنظيم ورش عمل أو إعداد كتيب يضم أهم معايير المسابقة وتجارب المشاركين، إلى جانب استخدام المنصات الرسمية للتواصل الاجتماعي كجسر لنشر هذه المبادرات وتحفيز الآخرين على خوضها".واختتمت الشهري رسالتها بالقول: رسالتي للمعلمين والمعلمات في المملكة أن يسارعوا إلى المشاركة في مثل هذه المسابقات الإبداعية التي تصنع الفارق، وأن يحوّلوا شغفهم إلى مبادرات عملية تُفيد الميدان التعليمي، وتفتح آفاقاً أوسع للتميز والإلهام.

results.title: Tech Week Singapore 2025: Government leaders and tech giants converge to discuss the impact of AI
results.description: Guest of Honour Mr Tan Kiat How, Senior Minister of State for Digital Development and Information will be speaking at the opening ceremony Tech Week Shanghai 2026 to be unveiled at the inaugural Tech Night 2025, Tech Week Singapore's networking session that brings together notable speakers and key industry leaders from prominent organisations Leaders from The Coca-Cola Company, OpenAI, Google Cloud, Microsoft, Oracle, World Trade Organisation and more, together with government officials, to lead the Main Stage and co-located shows SINGAPORE, Sept. 22, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- CloserStill Media, a global producer of market-leading events, has unveiled the notable attendees and programme highlights for Tech Week Singapore 2025, returning to Sands Expo & Convention Centre on 8–9 October 2025. Tech Week Singapore - 8 & 9 October 2025 Under the theme 'Connected Futures, Boundless Impact,' the award-winning event will spotlight how artificial intelligence (AI) is accelerating cross-industry collaboration – from cloud, AI, AI infrastructure and cybersecurity to digital marketing and e-commerce – positioning Tech Week Singapore as Asia's platform for industry-defining conversations and strategic partnerships. Opening Ceremony and Exclusive TourMr Tan Kiat How, Senior Minister of State for Digital Development and Information, will be the event's Guest of Honour (GOH), alongside VIPs including senior diplomatic members and ambassadors from top embassies, chambers of commerce and key associations. The opening ceremony will be followed by an executive tour for the GOH and VIPs, providing an exclusive showcase of the most innovative companies and technologies across Tech Week Singapore's co-located shows. The tour goes beyond a guided visit and aims to be a prestige networking experience, facilitating discussions for GOH, VIPs, industry leaders and policymakers to highlight Singapore as a hub for innovation and cross-border collaboration. More Voices, More Insights: Inspiring Collaboration in TechOver 550 regional and international speakers from leading organisations and government bodies such as The Coca-Cola Company, OpenAI, Google Cloud, Microsoft, Oracle, World Trade Organisation, the UK Government, the Government of Estonia and more will be speaking at the event. Key stakeholders across different industries will showcase groundbreaking innovations in AI and digital transformation through insightful keynotes, panel discussions and conference theatres, inspiring meaningful collaboration across the region to create boundless impact with tech. "AI is already reshaping industries like finance, aviation, manufacturing, and electronics – helping businesses cut through complexity, speed up decisions, and bring new ideas to market," said Andy Brown, Head of Go-to-Market for APAC, OpenAI. "With our latest model, GPT-5, we're seeing that progress accelerate in very tangible ways. Tech Week Singapore is a compelling event to share these lessons, collaborate with industry leaders, and explore how we can push AI even further to deliver real-world value for organisations and communities." Launch of Tech Week Shanghai 2026 , ASIA-ISAC and New Data Centre TechnologyTech Week Shanghai 2026 will also be officially unveiled at Tech Night 2025. Tech Week's expansion in the region is timely and aims to accelerate tech-driven discussions on data ecosystems and compliance that will fuel international growth across different sectors. Tech Night 2025, Tech Week's inaugural, high-impact networking session starting from 5pm on the first day, will further aid in catalysing collaboration between speakers, VIPs and exhibitors. It provides attendees with a golden opportunity to network and engage directly with C-suite leaders, influential decision-makers and tech trailblazers shaping the future of digital transformation. In addition, Tech Week Singapore is launching Asia Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Asia-ISAC) in response to the growing challenge posed by cyber threats. IBM's 2025 X-Force Threat Intelligence Index revealed that APAC experienced the most cyberattacks in 2024, accounting for 34% of all incidents investigated. With cyber threats continuing to escalate in the region, the need for organisations to bolster their cyber defences collaboratively has never been greater. Asia-ISAC is the first and only cross-industry, non-profit hub to help companies reduce the cost and impact of cyber attacks, and it will officially launch at Tech Week Singapore 2025. This cements Tech Week's reputation as an all-in-one event for all things tech, providing industry leaders with insights and announcements aligned with evolving threats and trends in the sector. Lastly, ECOLAB will be exclusively unveiling a new technology for data centres at their exhibition. Distinguished guests from government bodies and international business associations will also be present to witness the launch. 6 Co-Located Shows, 9 Country Pavilions: Refreshed to Showcase Global InnovationTo deliver unique perspectives from a wide array of industry leaders, Tech Week Singapore 2025 includes co-located shows, including Cloud & AI Infrastructure Asia, DevOps Live, Cyber Security World Asia, Data Centre World Asia, Big Data & AI World Asia and eCommerce Expo | DMEXCO Asia. Attendees can attend workshops by Google Cloud at Big Data & AI World Asia, lectures by ISACA and the opportunity to collect CPD (Continuing Professional Development) points at these events. Cloud Expo Asia's rebranding to Cloud & AI Infrastructure Asia in 2025 shows that cloud computing is no longer in siloes, but intertwining with AI to signal technology's advancement across industries. Asia's leading data show, Data Centre World Asia is also returning as the world's largest data centre event, expanding by 75% in space for a line-up of exhibitors this time round. The co-branded eCommerce Expo | DMEXCO Asia event, launched in partnership with Koelnmesse and BVDW, highlights Singapore's position as a dynamic hub for digital business across sectors, including marketing and retail innovation. This year, nine country pavilions will be featured – an increase from six pavilions last year – to allow more opportunities for local tech companies to showcase their innovations at a global scale. These include the Singapore pavilion, Zhejiang pavilion, Cooperation Council of the Arab States of the Gulf pavilion, Shaanxi pavilion, Austrade pavilion, Australia Global Victoria pavilion, Taiwan Taitra pavilion, Jiangsu pavilion and Pakistan pavilion. CloserStill Media's Managing Director for Asia Pacific, Andy Kiwanuka, said: "With this year's theme of 'Connected Futures, Boundless Impact' at Tech Week Singapore 2025, we are bringing together technology leaders from diverse industries to showcase how AI convergence can unlock innovation and growth across sectors. The launch of Tech Week Shanghai marks an important milestone and augments our vision to spark more conversations on how technology can drive collaboration, innovation, and growth across the region." Tech Week Singapore 2025 is expected to attract over 26,000 senior IT leaders, with more than 550 global exhibitors and over 550 regional and international speakers participating. The event will be held at Sands Expo & Convention Centre on 8–9 October 2025. Registration is now open. For all technology professionals, secure your complimentary pass at: https://bit.ly/Registration_MediaAlert. Download the Tech Week Singapore 2025 application from the Apple Store or Google Play Store for a go-to guide to navigating Southeast Asia's premier technology event. PR Newswire is the official media partner of Tech Week Singapore 2025. About CloserStill MediaCloserStill Media specialises in producing high-value, content-driven events that foster professional communities across Business Technologies, Healthcare, and Future Transport and Infrastructure sectors. CloserStill Media's portfolio includes the acclaimed Tech Week Singapore, featuring popular events such as Cloud & AI Infrastructure and Data Centre World Asia. Headquartered in London with 10 global offices, CloserStill Media operates with a robust team of 800 professionals across Singapore, the U.K., USA, Germany, and Spain. The company is recognised for its industry leadership, having won more exhibition awards than any other including accolades such as Best Exhibition, Best Event Launch, and Best Brand Expansion. For more information, visit www.closerstillmedia.com.

results.title: الإحصاء تنشر الرقم القياسي لتكاليف البناء أغسطس 2025
creator: watanpress@alwatan.com.sa(الرياض:-الوطن)
results.description: سجل الرقم القياسي لتكاليف البناء في المملكة ارتفاعًا نسبته (0.7%) خلال أغسطس 2025 مقارنةً بنظيره من العام الماضي، يعزى ذلك إلى ارتفاع تكاليف القطاع السكني بنسبة (0.8%) والقطاع غير السكني (0.6%), وذلك وفقًا لنشرة الرقم القياسي لتكاليف البناء لشهر أغسطس 2025 الصادرة من الهيئة العامة للإحصاء.وعلى أساس شهري، سجلت تكاليف البناء في القطاع السكني ارتفاعًا طفيفًا نسبته (0.1%) خلال أغسطس 2025 مقارنةً بالشهر السابق من العام نفسه، في حين لم تشهد تكاليف القطاع غير السكني أي تغير مقارنةً بالشهر السابق. يشار إلى أن الرقم القياسي لتكاليف البناء (CCI) يعكس تحركات الأسعار لمدخلات البناء عبر (51) بندًا من السلع والخدمات، تُجمع أسعارها بشكل شهري من مختلف مناطق المملكة وحُددت سنة 2023 كسنة أساس لقياس هذا المؤشر.
